Formal Definition: A registered user profile that enables a person to buy or sell sneakers on the SneakerPark platform
Term Synonyms: User Account / Customer Account / Seller Account

Formal Definition: The date when a physical sneaker item is received and logged into SneakerPark's warehouse after being shipped by the seller
A listing type where sellers accept bids from buyers and the item sells to the highest bidder
The process by which SneakerPark verifies that a sneaker item is genuine (not counterfeit) and in acceptable condition before allowing it to be listed for sale
The manufacturer or label name of a sneaker product (e.g. Nike or Adidas or Reebok)
A user who purchases sneakers from SneakerPark's marketplace either through bidding or direct purchase
The physical state or quality of a sneaker item describing wear level and completeness
A payment method associated with a user's account used to process order purchases
A person who interacts with SneakerPark either as a buyer or seller or both
A record of a customer support interaction including the reason for contact and resolution
Term Synonyms: Support Ticket / Help Request / Case / Inquiry

Formal Definition: Multiple user accounts belonging to the same person which violates SneakerPark's one-account-per-person policy
Business policy requiring sellers to list their authenticated items within 45 days of warehouse arrival or the items will be returned with shipping invoice
The intended wearer demographic for a sneaker product (Male or Female or Unisex)
The single authoritative version of a master data entity created by the MDM Hub by merging and resolving data from multiple source systems
Term Synonyms: Master Record / Single Source of Truth / Golden Master

Formal Definition: A physical pair of sneakers that has been shipped to SneakerPark's warehouse for authentication and eventual listing
The current state of a physical sneaker item in SneakerPark's warehouse workflow
An active or historical marketplace offering where a seller makes an authenticated sneaker item available for purchase or bidding
The sales method for a listing either auction-based or fixed-price
A completed purchase transaction where a buyer acquires one or more listed items using a payment method
An individual listing included in an order representing a line item in the purchase transaction
Term Synonyms: Line Item / Order Line / Purchase Item

Formal Definition: An identifier in the Listing Service that should reference the ItemID from the Inventory Management System
A user who ships sneakers to SneakerPark's warehouse for authentication and listing earning payment when items sell
The physical delivery of a purchased order from SneakerPark's warehouse to the buyer's address
The numeric size designation of a sneaker typically ranging from 0.5 (infant) to 22 (adult)
The category or style of footwear (e.g. Sneakers or Boots or Sandals or Dress Shoes)
A unique alphanumeric code provided by shipping carriers to track package location and delivery status
Term Synonyms: Shipment Tracking / Package Tracking / Tracking Code

Formal Definition: A person with a registered account on SneakerPark's platform capable of acting as buyer or seller or both
SneakerPark's physical facility where items are received authenticated stored and shipped
